The main class to use features in ish. The user will interact through this class. More...

#include <ISH.h>

 Loads new setting for key mapping and deletes the current settings. This methods gets called during Initialize() method so only call this method when you want to reload new file and settings.

 Updates the input system, call this once per frame.

 Call this method at the end of application to shutdown the input system. This method MUST be called to close down ish safly and to avoid chance of memory leaks.

Detailed Description

The main class to use features in ish. The user will interact through this class.

Member Function Documentation

float ISH::GetInputValue ( const char *  name,
PlayerIndexs  playerIndex = PlayerOne 
) [static]

Check for input (and value) in given key map setting.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Parameters:
namename of the key map/group setting to get e.g. "Fire"
playerIndexplayer and xbox controller to check input for
Returns:
returns 0.0f for no input, 1.0f or -1.0f for valid input and appropiate value for axis input (e.g. triggers or thumbstick on 360 controller)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

bool ISH::Initialize ( const char *  fileName = "keyConfig.ini",
PlayerIndexs  numberOfPlayers = PlayerMax 
) [static]

Initialization of the system. This method MUST be called at the start of the application before other input methods are called.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Parameters:
fileNameThe full path to the key config (.ini) file you want to load. it searches in current directory by default if no parameter is given
numberOfPlayersNumber of Players (controllers) to be used in the application
Returns:
returns true if sucesfully initialized, otherwise returns false (e.g. when failed to load key config file).

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

bool ISH::LoadKeyData ( const char *  fileName,
PlayerIndexs  playerToApplySetting = PlayerOne 
) [static]

Loads new setting for key mapping and deletes the current settings. This methods gets called during Initialize() method so only call this method when you want to reload new file and settings.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Parameters:
fileNameThe full path to the key config (.ini) file you want to load. it searches in current directory by default if no parameter is given
playerToApplySettingplayer (and controller) to load and apply new setting to
Returns:
returns true if sucesfully loaded, otherwise returns false (e.g. when failed to load key config file).

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

std::string ISH::SetInput ( const char *  fileName,
const char *  name,
InputOption  option,
PlayerIndexs  index,
bool  isPositive,
SaveOption  saveOption 
) [static]

Sets an input option, suggested to use for run-time configuration / key mapping.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Parameters:
fileNamefull path to the file you want to save to or create
namename of the input group (or key) to be used in GetInputValue() function
optionoption to choose how you want it to take input e.g. check when its pressed
indexindex of the player you want to apply new setting to
isPositivetrue if you want new setting to return positive value, otherwise false
saveOptionset how you want to save new setting. Refere to enum.h for options
Returns:
returns string of the input value if any, or returns "" if there was no valid input

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

void ISH::Shutdown ( void  ) [static]

Call this method at the end of application to shutdown the input system. This method MUST be called to close down ish safly and to avoid chance of memory leaks.

void ISH::Update ( void  ) [static]

Updates the input system, call this once per frame.
